climbs.name: Nevermind
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, Eric Bluemn, & Mike Engle; Spring 2019

content.description: Climb straight up featured grey limestone until gaining a pair of left slanting cracks.  Follow the cracks to near the top and step up and right to a stance and the anchors.
content.protection: 10 - 12 bolts, sport anchors.  Can lower with a 60 meter rope.
content.location: Starts below a pair of prominent left slanting cracks.

climbs.name: Give It Away
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, Eric Bluemn, & Mike Engle; Fall 2019

content.description: Start in steep featured rock with big pockets.  Pull through the steep section and onto a brief grey rock slab.  Move up to a yellow/tan corner until you can face climb out left to a hidden flake.  Lie back or a move or two and launch right across a thin face to the anchors.
content.protection: 10 -12 bolts, sport anchors.  Possible to lower with a single 60 meter rope.
content.location: Right most route on Alt Rock.

climbs.name: Dookie
climbs.fa: Eric Bluemn, Mike Engle, Chris Barnes & Vernon Phinney, 2019

content.description: Fun climbing on grey limestone yeilds to some chert pulling near the top.
content.protection: 10 - 12 bolts, sport anchors.  Can lower with a single 60 meter rope.
content.location: Left most route on Alt Rock.

climbs.name: Bang and Blame
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, Eric Bluemn, & Mike Engle; 2019

content.description: Start with some sharp pocket pulling on tan rock and pull through to a stance.  Work up grey limestone until it possible to move up and slightly right into yellow/tan rock to a stance below a small overlap.  This is where the fun begins.  Move  up and left then right and then left connecting discontinuous shallow cracks and jams with with big face moves.
content.protection: 10 - 12 bolts, sport anchors.  Can lower with a 60 meter rope.
content.location: Look for a tan/yellow bulge close to the ground.  Route has a name tag at the base.
